remarks: The image of an isomorphism under a functor is an isomorphism. Proposition 3.21 of [Adamek] p. 32.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
statement:
funciso.b $e |- B = ( Base ` D ) $.
funciso.s $e |- I = ( Iso ` D ) $.
funciso.t $e |- J = ( Iso ` E ) $.
funciso.f $e |- ( ph -> F ( D Func E ) G ) $.
funciso.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
funciso.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
funciso.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ( X I Y ) ) $.
funciso $p |- ( ph -> ( ( X G Y ) ` M ) e. ( ( F ` X ) J ( F ` Y ) ) ) $.
